intro: Lysimachia chingshuiensis, commonly known as the Chingshui bugleweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
